strings: <se_low>King Trode: I do hope you realise that the Princess and I have no intention of setting foot in that cave.

<se_low>King Trode: We are royals after all.
We can't go putting ourselves in danger like that.
<se_low>King Trode: So I'm relying on you to find the crystal ball!
<se_low>King Trode: It's terribly easy to get lost once you're out of town, so you be careful now, won't you, <hero>?
<se_low>King Trode: That said, there are paths to most places, so I shouldn't have thought you'd have too many problems.

<se_low>King Trode: The important thing is to stick to the main thoroughfares where there are fewer monsters.
You remember that.
<se_low>Yangus: Nah, once you see where yer 'eaded, just forget about the path and go straight there. No messin'!
<se_low>Yangus: Awright, so there might be a few more monsters, but a real man don't need to worry about that!

<se_low>King Trode: What a bothersome checkpoint, stopping us from moving along on our way!
Pah! We'll show you!
<se_low>Yangus: When I first come from the south, I managed to get through that checkpoint, y'know.
<se_low>Yangus: But then they stopped me an' asked me all these questions, like.
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, what is it about me that's so surpicious, eh? Bang outta line, they were.

<se_low>King Trode: It sounds reasonable enough to me.
I'd say those guards had a fairly good eye for trouble.

<se_low>Yangus: Well, that's just charmin', innit!?
So much for you bein' a gentleman!
<se_low>King Trode: What is that filthy bag you're insisting on carrying around with you?

<se_low>King Trode: Keep it well away from me, do you hear!?
It smells foul! Nay! Repulsive!
<se_low>Yangus: We was told that we'd get some kinda reward if we took the bag to that mountain shack, like.

<se_low>Yangus: But it's prob'ly best not to get our 'opes up.
That old bloke didn't exactly look loaded.

<se_high>Jessica: An old man's tool bag, huh...
I dread to think what's inside.
It smells disgusting.
<se_def>Angelo: When I first saw, or rather smelt that bag, I thought it must be full of rubbish!
<se_def>Angelo: But we've got it now, so we may as well go and give it to the old man and be rid of it.

<se_low>King Trode: Goodness!
All that happened inside a cave!?
<se_low>King Trode: It's extraordinary that this Geyzer monster knew all about us...

<se_low>King Trode: But how preposterous to say that you rescued me from the castle!
It was I who rescued you!

<se_low>King Trode: These monsters never get their facts straight!
Preposterous, I tell you!
<se_low>King Trode: Right! Time to return to Farebury and have Kalderasha tell us where to find Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>King Trode: That's why we went to all the trouble to get the crystal ball, after all.

<se_low>Yangus: Oi! Wot trouble did you go to, Grandad!?
It was the guv an' me that done all the 'ard work!

<se_low>King Trode: You ignorant imbecile!
Don't you realise that when my subjects suffer, I suffer!?

<se_low>Yangus: Subjects!?
Since when 'ave I been your subject!?
<se_low>Yangus: You can tell that crystal ball's a real'un. Glows better, like. Bet we'll get a good fortune outta this one, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: I can always spot when a thing's worth somefin'.
I was famous for it back in me younger days.

<se_low>King Trode: Dhoulmagus, you spineless clown!
To attack one's own master is an unforgivable offence!
<se_low>King Trode: I always knew he was evil, but I never imagined he was capable of this. What a fiend!
<se_low>King Trode: The situation between Kalderasha and Valentina may be intriguing, but we have to concentrate on Dhoulmagus!

<se_low>King Trode: Time to reckon with that rogue once and for all!
To the south! We leave at once!

<se_low>King Trode: Th-This must be Dhoulmagus's doing...
What terrifying power he must have to break through such formidable gates...
<se_low>King Trode: Even if we do manage to catch up with him, what chance do we stand in the face of such might!?

<se_low>King Trode: Oh! Listen to me, the voice of doom and gloom!
We mustn't allow ourselves to be discouraged.
<se_low>Yangus: Kalderasha reckons Dhoulmagus 'eaded south out of Farebury.

<se_low>Yangus: As far as I remember, that town Alexandria's down that way.
Why don't we try our luck there?
<se_low>Yangus: That Dhoulmagus is a nasty piece o' work, rollin' over the checkpoint like that, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: I don't care 'ow strong 'e is.
He don't 'ave to go round smashin' things to prove it.
<se_low>Yangus: I might not be the sharpest tool in the box, but I know one thing. An enemy o' yours is an enemy o' mine too, guv.
<se_low>King Trode: It's been many a day since I was last around these parts.

<se_low>King Trode: But now's not the time for sentimentality!
Onwards and upwards!
<se_low>Yangus: Comin' through 'ere reminds me of when you an' me fought together for the first time, guv.

<se_low>Yangus: Cor, that was a tough one, eh!?
We were both so green back then.

<se_low>Yangus: Makes me realise how much stronger I've got.
An' now we've got a few mates to 'elp us out an' all, so it's a doddle really.

<se_high>Jessica: So the monsters around here are weaker than the ones around Alexandria.
That's worth remembering!
<se_def>Angelo: Farebury's not far from here, is it?
<se_def>Angelo: I've never strayed far from the abbey up to now, so it's not easy remembering all these new place names.
<se_low>King Trode: Well, Kalderasha said we should try here, but I don't see any sign of that confounded Dhoulmagus.
<se_low>King Trode: I'm not overly familiar with the geography around here. I thought there was a town or a port nearby, but there's no sign of that either.

<se_low>King Trode: Bother!
I have no idea where to go next.
<se_low>King Trode: Perhaps we were a little hasty leaving that last town so soon.

<se_low>Yangus: This place certainly brings back memories!
I spent a bit o' time 'ere before I met you, guv.
<se_low>Yangus: I was still stuck in the old life o' crime back then, though. The place didn't look nearly so nice. Me neither for that matter.
<se_low>Yangus: Look at me now, though, comin' back a clean an' 'onest man. Well, 'onest at least. Who'd 'ave thought it, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: You know, I never used to take a blind bit o' notice of what anyone else said.
<se_low>Yangus: But if you told me not to go somewhere, I'd stop right there in me tracks, guv.
<se_low>King Trode: So is it decided where we're going to next, <leader>?
<se_low>King Trode: Really? Hmm... So we're aiming for the tower in the east that was mentioned in that letter?
<se_low>King Trode: Hmm... Yes, I suppose that's not a bad idea as such. I wonder...
<se_low>Yangus: You thinkin' of goin' to that tower in the east wot you read about in that letter? Nice one, guv! You've got guts!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, then!
Wot we waitin' for!?
<se_low>King Trode: I say! It seems our party's grown somewhat! Well, let's see if youth can succeed where experience failed!
<se_low>King Trode: I'm rather worried that we're getting so distracted from pursuing Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Bangerz: If anything happened to Jessica so soon after Alistair died, I reckon it'd be the end of Alexandria.
<se_high>Bangerz: I suppose I shouldn't really be telling strangers private stuff like that, though.

<se_high>Bangerz: ...Well, whatever!
We don't have time to hang around chatting anyway.
<se_low>Yangus: Why does this little brat 'ave to come all the way to the tower wiv us, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Bit overly keen if you ask me...

<se_low>King Trode: I beg your pardon!?
You're going to climb up that tower!?
<se_low>King Trode: Well, that sounds like it could be a bit tricky. So, you run along and Medea and I will cheer you on from here.
<se_low>Yangus: I bet there'll be a few nasty monsters in that tower, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Better make sure we're ready before we grace 'em wiv our presents.

<se_low>King Trode: That diabolical Dhoulmagus!
He's a cold-blooded killer! A soulless savage!
A vile villain of the highest order!

<se_low>King Trode: We haven't a moment to lose!
We must catch that rogue if it's the last thing we do!
<se_low>King Trode: He'll soon feel the crushing blow of my wrath!
<se_low>Yangus: Now we've really gotta find this Dhoulmagus after wot 'e did in that tower.
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose we better tell Bangerz that Jessica's okay first, though, eh?

<se_low>King Trode: That diabolical Dhoulmagus!
He's a cold-blooded killer! A soulless savage!
A vile villain of the highest order!

<se_low>King Trode: We haven't a moment to lose!
We must catch that rogue if it's the last thing we do!
<se_low>King Trode: He'll soon feel the crushing blow of my wrath!
<se_low>Yangus: I 'ad such a good long sleep back at the inn there that I've totally forgot...
<se_low>Yangus: Wot was it we're supposed to be doin' again!?

<se_low>King Trode: That diabolical Dhoulmagus!
He's a cold-blooded killer! A soulless savage!
A vile villain of the highest order!

<se_low>King Trode: We haven't a moment to lose!
We must catch that rogue if it's the last thing we do!
<se_low>King Trode: He'll soon feel the crushing blow of my wrath!
<se_low>Yangus: That Jessica said she wanted to say sorry to us, but then she went an' done a runner!

<se_low>Yangus: She's a bit wild, that one.
More trouble than she's worth if you ask me.

<se_low>King Trode: That diabolical Dhoulmagus!
He's a cold-blooded killer! A soulless savage!
A vile villain of the highest order!

<se_low>King Trode: We haven't a moment to lose!
We must catch that rogue if it's the last thing we do!
<se_low>King Trode: He'll soon feel the crushing blow of my wrath!
<se_low>Yangus: That monster was no match for us, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: It still feels good to floor somefin' that big, though, easy or not!
<se_low>King Trode: If you include the Princess and myself, we're quite a large group now.

<se_low>King Trode: If we all work together, I'm confident there'll be nothing we can't handle!
Safety in numbers and all that.

<se_high>Jessica: Hey!
This is the wrong continent!
Why are we heading north!?

<se_high>Jessica: Get it together!
We're supposed to be going after Dhoulmagus!
Let's hurry up back to the south!
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose it makes sense to look back over where you've already been before you go any further. Nice idea, guv!
<se_low>Yangus: I used to just go off like a bull at a gate in the old days. I'd always regret it when I ended up goin' too far.
<se_def>Angelo: The northern continent... I hardly ever got to come here, what with being stuck in the abbey all the time.
<se_def>Angelo: Anyway, I don't know what it is you've come here for, but let's hurry up and get it out of the way.
<se_low>King Trode: I'm sure the informer said we should go to the west of Port Prospect.
<se_low>King Trode: Let's try that first before going off anywhere else.
<se_high>Jessica: So we're back here...
<se_high>Jessica: I haven't really been away long enough to miss the place, but it is good to be back. Relaxing, you know.

<se_low>Yangus: If I remember right, you can't go west from Port Prospect.
Weren't there a landslide or somefin'?
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe they've managed to clear a way through now, though, eh?
<se_def>Angelo: A ship... Oh, if only we had a ship, I could break hearts in ports all over the world!
<se_low>King Trode: Hmph. It's good that we were able to secure our passage across the sea, but there are still no clues as to Dhoulmagus's whereabouts.

<se_low>King Trode: There's nothing for it!
You'll have to just go to a place with lots of people and start asking questions.
<se_low>Yangus: Looks like we prob'ly don't 'ave much choice, but do we really 'ave to let that Jessica tag along?

<se_low>Yangus: You know what birds are like.
Always moanin' about bein' tired and their feet achin'. They're a right pain!
<se_low>Yangus: To be 'onest, I'd much rather it just be us three blokes, but there you go. Ain't up to me, I s'pose.
<se_high>Jessica: We don't have time to mess around here! With every passing second, Dhoulmagus is getting further from our grasp! We have to find him fast!
<se_low>King Trode: Still no clues as to Dhoulmagus's whereabouts? ...Hmph!
<se_low>King Trode: If only I didn't look like this, I wouldn't have to rely on you. No doubt I'd get some answers if people knew I was King!
<se_low>King Trode: Still, it can't be helped that my retainers seem to find the simplest tasks impossible. Just keep at it until you get a lead, <leader>.
<se_low>Yangus: Most o' the folk that go prayin' at Maella Abbey stay over at Simpleton.
<se_low>Yangus: There used to be a bit more goin' on round 'ere in the old days, but that's about the only place left now.
<se_low>Yangus: So if we go to Simpleton, we'll prob'ly be able to find out more about the abbey. Genius, eh!?

<se_high>Jessica: Um, can you promise me something?
When we find Dhoulmagus, I want you to let me take him on alone.

<se_high>Jessica: Thank you.
You're a good guy, <hero>.

<se_high>Jessica: But if I look like I'm in trouble, you will come and help, right?
That's the other part of the promise.
<se_high>Jessica: I guess you're right. He's not your regular bad guy. I guess there's no way I could defeat him all by myself.

<se_high>Jessica: But still...
I want to be the one to make him pay, you know? For what he did to Alistair...

<se_low>King Trode: I knew a lord that lived in these parts a long time ago.
Terrible womaniser, he was.
<se_low>King Trode: He lost everything he had through excessive gambling. I sent flowers when he died. He paid for his decadence with his health... Poor fellow.
<se_low>Yangus: We 'ad a bit of a casino goin' back where I used to live, y'know.
<se_low>Yangus: I could wipe the floor wiv that Angelo geezer, no probs!
<se_high>Jessica: We should hurry up over to the abbey. I don't want to keep the ring that creep gave me a minute longer than I have to!

<se_low>King Trode: I don't believe it!
A jester resembling Dhoulmagus has broken into the abbey!?

<se_low>King Trode: That good-for-nothing villain!
What does he think he's doing this time!?
<se_low>King Trode: We can't just stand by and do nothing! Angelo mentioned a secret passage from the ruin. We must go there at once!
<se_high>Jessica: A jester!? I can't believe it's just a coincidence! If it is Dhoulmagus who's broken into Abbot Francisco's room, we can't let him get away!
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo reckons we can get there through a secret passage from the ruin. We just have to follow the river bank to the left and we'll come to it.
<se_high>Jessica: Apparently we'll be able to use the Templar's ring to get in.
<se_high>Jessica: We have to hurry! I can't let anyone else die at his hands!

<se_low>Yangus: This ain't good, guv!
I'll bet that geezer Angelo was talkin' about Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: He may be a young upstart an' all, but we'd better listen to him this time and get to the ruin sharpish! Along the bank, 'e said...
<se_low>King Trode: Come to think of it, there was a terrible epidemic around these parts back in my great-grandfather's days.
<se_low>King Trode: The poor souls at the old abbey almost certainly died because of it. What an awful way to go...
<se_high>Jessica: That poor soul has been suffering alone all these years...

<se_high>Jessica: It's time to put an end to his pain.
Right, <hero>?

<se_low>Yangus: Huh! I let me guard down back there!
Who'd have thought a monster like that'd get the better of the legend'ry Yangus!?

<se_low>Yangus: We don't 'ave time for this neither!
We've gotta get to the Abbot's room pronto!
<se_low>King Trode: Dhoulmagus appears to have a fixation with fire. He burnt down Master Rylus's house when he attacked him.
<se_low>King Trode: So it's bound to be him who's set fire to the bridge. Blast! That loathsome jester!
<se_low>King Trode: !!!

<se_low>King Trode: For goodness' sake!
What are you dithering around for!?
Hurry up and go after that Angelo chap!

<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus is probably with Abbot Francisco as we speak!
We have to hurry to the abbey!
<se_low>Yangus: Maybe it'd be better if we sent Jessica back to Alexandria, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, she's got guts an' all that, but this Dhoulmagus ain't messin' around.
<se_low>Yangus: She ain't cut out for this sorta thing, if you ask me! She should be dolled up in a nice frock suppin' tea, not out fightin' monsters!

<se_low>Yangus: That wise guy Angelo's gone off on 'is own.
Wonder if 'e's okay...
<se_low>Yangus: We'd better go an' check on the Abbot an' make sure Angelo's safe too. In for a penny, in for a pound an' all that!

<se_low>King Trode: Well, well!
So Angelo's joined the ranks of my retainers now too!
<se_def>Angelo: Hey, I'm just coming along for the ride for a while. I'm not in the habit of pledging my services to monsters.
<se_low>King Trode: What impudence! You're even more uncouth than that oaf Yangus! Being in your sorry company makes me look all the more dignified!
<se_def>Angelo: Now wait a minute, ‘Grandad’!
<se_low>King Trode: It's been a custom since ancient times that a king on an incognito excursion must have a man on each side and a beautiful woman accompanying him.
<se_low>King Trode: And when the entourage rests at lodgings, the young woman disrobes and thoroughly bathes herself and her King. It's tradition, I tell you!

<se_high>Jessica: There are still plenty of places we haven't explored on this continent.
Dhoulmagus must be here somewhere!
<se_high>Jessica: You know, <hero>...
<se_high>Jessica: It's not just Alistair's death that needs to be avenged. It's the deaths of everyone Dhoulmagus murdered.

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to stop him.
For all of their sakes.
<se_low>Yangus: Y'know, apart from the abbey, there's also a big town an' a castle on this cont'nent.

<se_low>Yangus: They're both a fair old way away, mind.
We should get some shut-eye at the inn before we get goin'.
<se_def>Angelo: It was about time I left the abbey, really. Far too many rules and regulations and not enough fun for my liking.
<se_def>Angelo: And besides...I wouldn't mind getting to know the delightful Jessica more intimately too.
<se_low>King Trode: It doesn't look like we'll find anyone along the main path who'll be able to point us in the direction of Dhoulmagus.
<se_high>Jessica: There's no point just wandering about aimlessly. We should go to a town or a village where there are lots of people we can ask.

<se_low>King Trode: Very well! <Cap><leader>!
Medea! Time to move on!
<se_low>King Trode: I believe I'm right in saying you don't have any parents or siblings, <hero>.
<se_low>King Trode: Hmm... Jessica lost her brother to Dhoulmagus, and Angelo hardly gets on well with his.
<se_low>King Trode: When I think about it like that, I wonder if Medea and I playing happy families is a bit much for you all.
<se_high>Jessica: Does this dress suit me? I saved up my pocket money for ages and bought it on the quiet. You don't think it's too...revealing, do you?

<se_high>Jessica: I've always wanted clothes like these.
They're so much easier to move around in.
But mother always refused to buy them for me.
<se_high>Jessica: She said I was a lady and I must dress as such. She called this kind of outfit ‘vulgar’!
<se_high>Jessica: She just has no idea!
<se_high>Jessica: Angelo and King Trode are unusually quiet today, huh?
<se_high>Jessica: I'm all for a bit of peace and quiet every now and then, but it's kind of disconcerting.
<se_low>Yangus: I'm sure I've prob'ly told you this before, guv, but this is my old neck o' the woods.

<se_low>Yangus: I can show you round the place!
You name it, I know all the places 'ere on this cont'nent!

<se_low>Yangus: I'll tell ya one thing for starters.
There's strong monsters down south an' the path's pretty steep an' all. I say go north.
<se_low>Yangus: If ya keep goin' long enough to the northeast, you'll come to Ascantha Castle.

<se_low>Yangus: Just leg it on over to somewhere you think's a likely spot for a castle!
You'll find it easy enough!
<se_def>Angelo: ...Hm? What did I say?

<se_def>Angelo: Nothing.
I was just thinking, that's all.
Um, <hero>?

<se_def>Angelo: That guy...
The one who killed the Abbot.
His name was Dhoulmagus, right?
<se_def>Angelo: Dhoulmagus...

<se_def>Angelo: When we find him, I'll have to thank him.
That's what I was thinking.

<se_def>Angelo: It's because of him that I finally escaped the abbey.
I certainly owe him, that's for sure.

<se_def>Angelo: Why are you looking at me like that?
Is my hair out of place?

<se_def>Angelo: Come on, time to get a move on!
We're supposed to be giving chase, after all.
<se_low>King Trode: Ah, Medea's mother was a beautiful and intelligent woman.
<se_low>King Trode: My dear departed wife! I don't know how I carried on when I lost you...<page>King Trode: The thought of our darling Medea was the only thing between me and despair.
<se_low>King Trode: We must do all we can to alleviate King Pavan's misery. Losing a beloved is like losing half of oneself!
<se_low>King Trode: Come on! No more dilly-dallying!
<se_low>King Trode: I had no idea such a mysterious place existed just south of Ascantha!

<se_low>King Trode: Intriguing!
Right! Time to climb up to the top and see what's there!

<se_high>Jessica: ...This is just a hunch.
Call it women's intuition if you like, but<endash>

<se_low>King Trode: Hmph!?
What are you blithering on about, girl?
<se_high>Jessica: There's no way a girl's going to be that dedicated for no reason. Not a chance!
<se_low>King Trode: Whatever are you talking about!?

<se_high>Jessica: Oh, please!
Can't you just be quiet and let me speak!?
<se_low>King Trode: The cheek of it!
<se_high>Jessica: Hey, <hero>, the moon's been really big lately, right? I bet there'll be a full moon before long.
<se_high>Jessica: When I was a kid, I heard this story about how the man in the moon can make everyone's wishes come true...
<se_high>Jessica: It was probably just a fairy story, I guess.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a fair old schlep from Ascantha Castle to that Emma's 'ouse, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: I doubt she gets to come 'ome all that often, what wiv it bein' so far. Shame.

<se_low>Yangus: The old lady's prob'ly right.
We'll go all the way up to the top o' the mountain, and there'll be nuffin' doin'.
<se_low>Yangus: Still, it's all part of a man's sense of adventure, eh? Believin' in stupid fairy tales and tryin' to prove they're true!
<se_low>Yangus: It'll be a laugh. Somefin' funny to look back on. Let's 'ead upstream to the mountain and see wot all the fuss is about!
<se_def>Angelo: So it's been two years since the beloved Queen of Ascantha died...

<se_def>Angelo: And yet they're all still in mourning.
The King must be a passionate man...
Either that or he's just soft.
<se_def>Angelo: I'll bet they were head over heels in love when they got married.

<se_def>Angelo: And then she died before they had time to get sick of each other.
It's the perfect love story.
<se_def>Angelo: I wonder what it is that happens on the night of a full moon.
<se_def>Angelo: There was a beautiful full moon that night Dhoulmagus attacked Abbot Francisco...
<se_def>Angelo: Hopefully nothing like that will happen this time. All this death and killing is getting rather tedious.
<se_low>King Trode: I'm all for helping people out of a predicament, but we've no idea now where Dhoulmagus has run off to.

<se_low>King Trode: He must've have come in this direction from Alexandria.
How could he have slipped through our fingers!?
<se_low>King Trode: We must retrace our steps and see if we can find him!
<se_low>King Trode: There's bound to be a clue to his whereabouts somewhere. Let's go!
<se_high>Jessica: The ferry only runs between Port Prospect and Peregrin Quay.
<se_high>Jessica: So if Dhoulmagus went to all that trouble trying to block our passage with that monster...
<se_high>Jessica: ...he must be somewhere on the south-eastern continent! We should look harder!
<se_low>Yangus: As far as I know, the ferry only goes between Port Prospect an' that Peregrin Quay near the abbey.

<se_low>Yangus: Maybe we got a bit ahead of ourselves, guv.
I reckon we might get a lead back at Maella, meself.

<se_low>Yangus: It's a pretty nice buildin', an' all.
Maybe it wouldn't be a bad idea to go an' pray ev'ryfin' works out awright, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Eh, it takes me back a bit bein' round these parts again.

<se_low>Yangus: It's been a fair few years since I was last round 'ere.
But now I'm finally 'ome at last.
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno... We got the Venus' tear, but what do we do wiv it, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Not much point givin' it to 'er after all these years...

<se_high>Jessica: We've come a pretty long way, huh?
Is there something you were planning on doing round here?

<se_high>Jessica: Our main objective is to catch up with Dhoulmagus.
Don't forget that, okay!?

<se_high>Jessica: So, where to next?
Let's try not to get side-tracked this time!
<se_def>Angelo: We haven't been travelling together long, but I can already tell you're pretty casual when it comes to navigation.
<se_def>Angelo: We're supposed to be chasing Dhoulmagus and yet you bring us all the way out here for no apparent reason!
<se_def>Angelo: Not that I mind the odd detour, within reason.

<se_def>Angelo: I get the distinct impression that we're lost.
Am I right or am I right?

<se_def>Angelo: Keep it together!
